channel.title: 2 on Patrick C. Trettenbrein
channel.description: Recent content in 2 on Patrick C. Trettenbrein

item.title: Functional neuroanatomy of language without speech: An ALE meta-analysis of sign language
Psycholinguistic norms for more than 300 lexical signs in German Sign Language (DGS)
Controlling video stimuli in sign language and gesture research: The OpenPoseR package for analyzing OpenPose motion tracking data in R
50 Years Later: A Tribute to Eric Lenneberg’s Biological Foundations of Language
item.description: Editorial for the Biolinguistics special issue celebrating the 50-year anniversary of the publication of Eric Lenneberg’s Biological Foundations of Language.

item.title: 50 years later: A conversation about the biological study of language with Noam Chomsky
item.description: An interview with Noam Chomsky, a co-founder of the field of biolinguistics, contemporary, and friend of Eric Lenneberg where he talks about the early days of the field, his work and relation with Lenneberg, and a number of other questions and scientific issues that (still) captivate us 50 years later.

item.title: The demise of the synapse as the locus of memory: A looming paradigm shift?
The “grammar” in Universal Grammar: A biolinguistic clarification
